column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have used this for over 2 years and skin is smooth and wrinkle free except for above upper lip. It did not remove a few old age spots BUT I didn't get any more. It is expensive but at my age worth it, no side effects noticed.I am continuing to use it daily

column2: fewrinkles, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have used Renova for over 10 years when in my 50's many people stopped me to ask what I used on my skin as it would always look fresh and smooth with very little wrinkles. So to me this is a wonderful drug for wrinkles and putting collagen back. LOVE IT!

column2: LoveLife, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After about the first 3 months my skin began to look smooth, soft, and less wrinkles.  Definately the best product I have ever used for my skin.  It actually works!

column2: good skin, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been using this for 2 years. I have found that it is very effective for fine lines, shrinking pore size, improving texture and with excessive pigmentation. It does cause a lot of peeling and redness and irritation. It took about 6 weeks before my skin adjusted to this medication.

column2: lillym, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Skin doctor prescribed for redness of the face (not rosacea). Makes my skin very dry, red, bumpy and itchy. Looks worse than before. You can't use it near eyes, nose or mouth so I don't understand how it can work on fine lines and wrinkles, if these ARE the spots that have wrinkles! VERY EXPENSIVE and I think not worth it. If you read carefully the info it says that all (if any) benefits reverse to the old when stop using this cream. Also, too many side effects and dangers to the health. Just not worth it.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have seen my acne get better and some of the lines and sun damage lessen or look like they did. Had no problem with peeling or redness.

column2: Fabulous at 50, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've recently started using this medication to reduce pore size and help with sun damage (pigmentation) on my face. I am am using other medications too for rocasa. I am impressed after only a few weeks. A few large pores are smaller and my fine wrinkles between my eyes appear less deeper. I plan to adjust my dosage to every other day if redness or excessive peeling begins. Very expensive!! and not covered by my insurance. Worth the cost! 50th birthday present to myself

column9: it made the skin on my face peal off,and have red spots.  not good.
